property.name: text
property.value: Click the run to execute. The new window to the left shows the original model. The right one shows the result of static evaluation step by step.

property.name: text
property.value: This model demonstrates how one can optimize a model. The original input is the model in Sinewave.xml, which the ReadModel event reads in. The contents of this model are then stored in the Model parameter. The Transform event contains a Ptera submodel that gets repeatedly executed. The transformation rules inside are applied to the input model until no further optimization is possible (i.e., a fixpoint is reached). The submodel is executed each time the Transform event is processed. Inside, it has 3 transformation rules. At most one of them is successfully applied each time. When none of them is applied, the optimization terminates.

property.name: text
property.value: A similar demo is in ptolemy/actor/gt/demo/ConstOptimization.
